bibl.title: Honorable Discharge Certificate for John J. Moran, July 2, 1900

div1.p: Moran is honorably discharged from the Army of the United States, with permission to re-enlist.

div1.head: Honorable Discharge Certificate for John J. Moran, July 2, 1900

opener.salute: To all whom it may concern

div1.p:
Know Ye, That John J. Moran .........
an Acting Hospital Steward of the Hospital Corps Regiment
of the U.S. Army who was enlisted on the third day of
July .... one thousand eight hundred and ninety seven
to serve three years is hereby Honorably Discharged from the
Army of the United States by reason of expiration of term
of enlistment .....................

The said John J. Moran ........ was born in
......... in the State of Ireland
and when enlisted was 21 3/12 years of age, five feet 5 1/4
inches high, fair ... complexion, blue #10. eyes, black hair
and by occupation a clerk ..............

Given under my hand at Columbia Barracks, Cuba,
this Second .. day of July ..., in the year of our Lord
one thousand nine hundred ...........................
No objection to his reenlistment is known to exist.

p.hi:
Captain and Assistant Surgeon, U.S.A.,
Surgeon

div1.p:
Previous Service: None ..........
Non-commissioned officer: Acting Hospital Steward Sinced July 28. 1898.
Marksmanship no............
Battles, engagements, skirmishes, expeditions: Served during the
Spanish-American War, 1898 in the United States. Served with the Army of
occupation in Cuba, since July 28. 99..
Wounds received in service: none........
Physical condition when discharged: good......
Married or single: Single..........
Remarks: Service honest and faithful........
................
div1.closer:
A. N. Stark, Captain and Assistant Surgeon, U.S.A.
Commanding: Detachment.
Paid in Full $699.70/100
Quemados Cuba
July 10, 1900
James W. Dawes
Maj. & Add. Paymaster, U.S.V.
HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
OFFICE OF CHIEF QUARTERMASTER,
HAVANA, CUBA, July 7, 1990
Entitled to transportation to the United States on
any U.S. Transport leaving the island within
one year from date of this discharge.
G. F. Humphrey
DEPUTY QUARTERMASTER GENERAL, U.S. ARMY,
CHIEF QUARTERMASTER, DIVISIONS OF CUBA.
CANCELLED
CANCELLED
CANCELLED
CANCELLED
Office of Chief Quartermaster,
HAVANA, CUBA, July 7,1900.
Transportation and subsistence furnished
the soldier from Havana, Cuba to New York N.Y.
DEPUTY QUARTERMASTER GENERAL U.S. ARMY.
CHIEF QUARTERMASTER, DIVISION OF CUBA.
